div.p: just to put things in perspective and
not about how old I am but to give you
an idea of how far things have come and
the older you get your eyes time is
compressed I was doing programming when
I was in eighth grade it was in basic it
was on punch cards it was being fed into
a card reader that was a good size how
things move fast things move quickly you
guys are a great example of that one of
the first things I did when I got it
elected I was in the legislature for 14
years went to the County Board in 2010
we made Cook County the largest
jurisdiction in the country to have an
open data portal I saw what was going
around the country we saw some great
opportunities for it and we actually put
great use to it Derek's associate
yourself with Derek doing all the work
along with Nick we created something
called look at cook calm it is such a
deep dive and graphic visualization into
the cook county budget I mean it's I'm
still amazed every time I go to it which
is a lot the public is able to take
advantage of that and it's one of the
things I want to tell you in it before I
just leave you with the resolution is
this a lot of you are focusing on the
work that you do and how that makes
things more transparent and really more
user-friendly from the public side ah
there's a very key component to what you
do that you may not think of the more
transparency and the more access and the
more interactivity that the public has
with their government and their elected
officials in particular it is requiring
them to be more responsive more honest
more user driven to provide these
services so you guys are really coming
at this from both ends you're helping
the citizens and at the same time you're
keeping government honest which can be a
trick to do every now and then but I but
I truly truly mean that I've seen over
the years the difference in my
colleagues attitudes are knowing that
public has access to information and
just the things that we can do whether
it's things we're doing at the forest
preserve whether it's the budgetary
types of things what you do is not a
drill it's not an exercise I know you
know that it's making a fantastic
difference where the rubber meets the
road and I really hope you do know that
doing the resolution for the five-year
anniversary I mean that was really a
no-brainer I've been able to experience
firsthand the type of work that people
like you are doing the type of impact
it's having on people so for me to be
able to congratulate not just the
organization per se but all of you that
make it up of it's just it's really it's
it's a privilege I'm glad to be a part
of this I'm glad to be the chairman of
the Technology Committee on the cook
county board because you get to see
these things happening I am going to do
you all a big favor I'm going to spare
you the reading of the resolution take
my word on it it says a whole lot of
good things about you guys about Jack
night and about the things that get done
so I'm sure you're going to scan it or
get it and post it somewhere you can
read it all there it's been a privilege
to be here I don't want to overdo my
five minutes which I probably already
dead but thank you all for all you do
[Applause]
